meanings.definition: A playing card with a single spot.
meanings.sent1: In the game, the ace is the most important card.
meanings.sent2: I need an ace to complete my winning hand in poker.
meanings.sent3: The ace looked lonely among the other cards.
meanings.sent4: She played her ace at just the right moment.
meanings.sent5: The ace stood out with its single spot.

meanings.definition: A person who excels at a particular sport or activity.
meanings.sent1: He is an ace at basketball, always scoring the most points.
meanings.sent2: The team's ace pitcher led them to victory.
meanings.sent3: The ace athlete could do backflips effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: She's the ace of the swimming team, breaking records left and right.
meanings.sent5: Being an ace requires dedication and skill.

meanings.definition: To score an ace in tennis.
meanings.sent1: She managed to ace her serve, winning the point.
meanings.sent2: He aced the match with a powerful serve.
meanings.sent3: The ball seemed to magically ace over the net.
meanings.sent4: Her opponent was surprised when she aced the game.
meanings.sent5: To ace in tennis takes practice and precision.

meanings.definition: To perform extremely well in a test or exam.
meanings.sent1: She aced the math test, getting every question right.
meanings.sent2: He always aces his exams without much effort.
meanings.sent3: The student was thrilled to ace the difficult exam.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to ace exams impressed her classmates.
meanings.sent5: Acing the exam boosted her confidence.
